result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dwight D. McDuffy

records.addlTxt:
Clerk: Amanda. 
Cases Called at 3:37 pm. 
INCLUDES: 20CF126, 21CF1286, 22CF219, 22CF569. 
State appears by ADA Cody Marschall.  Defendant appears from MCJ and with Attorney John Wallace. 
VRCW. 

Date & Time set for FPT; Parties have reached a Plea Agreement. 

Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights filed.  

State moves to: 
DRI all counts in 22CF219 and 22CF569. 
DRI Ct.1 and Ct.3-Ct.6 in 20CF126. 
DRI Ct.2-5 in 21CF1286. 

COURT GRANTS ABOVE.

PLEA to:
20CF126 --
Ct.2>>NO CONTEST. 

21CF1286 --
Ct.1>>NO CONTEST. 
Ct.6>>NO CONTEST. 
Ct.7>>NO CONTEST. 

COURT advises defendant of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & questions defendant to understanding; 
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & voluntary made, a factual basis & defendant guilty;

COURT ORDERS: 
20CF126 --
Ct.2 >> 4 years WSPS, 1.5 years IC and 2.5 years ES, to run CONCURRENT to Ct.1 in 21CF1286.  CONDITIONS of ES:  Assessments/Treatment/Counseling deemed appropriate by agent. Maintain full time work/school or combination of the two, and if not so fully engaged, complete 9 hours CS per week. Maintain absolute sobriety. No contact with victim(s) unless approved by agent.  AODA and follow through.  Pay CC/DNA surcharge and provide sample. 30, 60, 90 and 120 day review hearings.  

21CF1286 --
Ct.1 >> 4 years WSPS, 1.5 years IC and 2.5 years ES, to run CONCURRENT to Ct.2 in 21CF126.  CONDITIONS of ES:  Assessments/Treatment/Counseling deemed appropriate by agent. Maintain full time work/school or combination of the two, and if not so fully engaged, complete 9 hours CS per week. Maintain absolute sobriety. No contact with victim(s) unless approved by agent.  AODA and follow through.  Pay CC/DNA surcharge and provide sample. 30, 60, 90 and 120 day review hearings.  
Ct.6 >> 6 months MCJ, to run CONCURRENT to Ct.7 in 21CF1286 and CONSECUTIVE to the felony counts. Assessments/Treatment/Counseling deemed appropriate by agent. Maintain full time work/school or combination of the two, and if not so fully engaged, complete 9 hours CS per week. Maintain absolute sobriety. No contact with victim(s) unless approved by agent.  AODA and follow through.  Pay CC/DNA surcharge and provide sample. 30, 60, 90 and 120 day review hearings.  
Ct.7 >>  3 months MCJ, to run CONCURRENT to Ct.6 in 21CF1286 and CONSECUTIVE to the felony counts. Assessments/Treatment/Counseling deemed appropriate by agent. Maintain full time work/school or combination of the two, and if not so fully engaged, complete 9 hours CS per week. Maintain absolute sobriety. No contact with victim(s) unless approved by agent.  AODA and follow through.  Pay CC/DNA surcharge and provide sample. 30, 60, 90 and 120 day review hearings. 

COURT grants 498 days credit on each count. 
Defendant is eligible for programming. 
Adj: 4:10 pm.

DATES: 
FPT/Tent. Plea 9/26 @ 3:30

ADA Cody Marschall appears in person; Atty Wallace appears in person
DATES: 
PTC 9/6/22 @ 10:10 am
Pre-trial conference on July 28, 2022 at 11:45 am.

cc: Branch 5.
Calendar call on June 9, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Preliminary Hearing on May 18, 2022 at 09:00 am.

INCLUDES 20CF126, 21CF1286, 22CF219 and 22CF569:  No contact with victim(s): K.D.  Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.  Absolute sobriety from and no possession of controlled substances except prescriptions taken as prescribed.  Report to ATTIC Corrections Services (715-848-3202) within one business day of release. Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level (4) supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.
